anti_patterns.name: Mixed Convention Chaos
anti_patterns.problem: Using multiple naming conventions (Clean ABAP and Hungarian) in the same codebase creates confusion and maintenance burden
anti_patterns.solution: Choose one convention per project and enforce it consistently. Use code review and linting tools to catch violations

anti_patterns.name: Cryptic Abbreviations
anti_patterns.problem: Using abbreviations that are unclear (e.g., 'mgr' for manager vs margin) reduces code readability
anti_patterns.solution: Use full descriptive names. Only abbreviate when the abbreviation is universally understood in the domain

anti_patterns.name: Inconsistent Prefix Usage
anti_patterns.problem: Applying prefixes inconsistently (sometimes ZCL_, sometimes ZCL, sometimes no prefix) breaks searchability and organization
anti_patterns.solution: Document prefix rules clearly and use automated checks (abaplint, custom scripts) to enforce consistency

anti_patterns.name: Language Mixing
anti_patterns.problem: Mixing English and non-English names in the same artifact violates Clean ABAP principles and international standards
anti_patterns.solution: Use English exclusively for all names (classes, methods, variables) regardless of local language requirements

anti_patterns.name: Overly Long Names
anti_patterns.problem: Creating extremely long names (50+ characters) reduces readability and breaks formatting guidelines
anti_patterns.solution: Balance descriptiveness with brevity. Aim for 20-40 characters. Use domain context to shorten where appropriate
